stanza.line: Where art thou Muse that thou forget so longlong
To speak of that which gives thee all thy mightmight
Spend thou thy fury on some worthless songsong
Darkening thy power to lend base subjects lightlight
Return forgetful Muse and straight redeemredeem
In gentle numbers time so idly spentspent
Sing to the ear that doth thy lays esteemesteem
And gives thy pen both skill and argumentargument
Rise resty Muse my love sweet face surveysurvey
If time have any wrinkle graven therethere
If any be a satire to decaydecay
And make time spoils despised everywhereeverywhere
Give my love fame faster than Time wastes lifelife
So thou prevent his scythe and crooked knifeknife
